page.title: 05NATURAL HISTORY
page.content: THERE ARE A NUMBER OF INTERESTING AND UNIQUE THINGS ABOUT NORTH HILL. IT IS PART OF THE EXMOOR NATIONAL PARK AND HAS AN IMPORTANT PART TO PLAY IN THE NEED TO PRESERVE WILDLIFE. ALTHOUGH THE HILL IS FARMED, THERE ARE MANY PARTS WHICH ARE WILD MOORLAND. THESE ARE DOMINATED BY HEATHERS, BILBERRY AND GRASSES. GORSE HAS BECOME DOMINANT IN PARTS DUE TO THE LACK OF PROPER MANAGEMENT. YEARS AGO, GORSE WAS BURNED REGULARLY IN ORDER TO ALLOW THE SHEEP TO GRAZE THE YOUNG SHOOTS. TODAY THIS IS NOT SO NECESSARY AND THE FARMERS DON'T BURN THE GORSE REGULARLY. DEER ARE FAMOUS ON EXMOOR AND THIS IS NO EXCEPTION. THE RED DEER IS COMMON ON THE UPLAND AREAS BUT DUE TO THE PRESSURE OF TOURISM ONE DOESN'T SEE THEM VERY OFTEN.
